items.content_html:
This is similar to #11499.

The constructor isn't especially useful to begin with, keeping track of
when individual object parameters were supported isn't practically
useful. What matters in practice is when the properties on the event
were supported, which is already captured.
items.title: Remove api.KeyboardEvent.KeyboardEvent.code_and_key_in_init entry
Add spec links for some <iframe> attributes

items.content_html: Fixes #11426.
items.title: Remove spec_urls to Web IDL iterable/maplike/setlike declarations

items.content_html:
This is entirely produced using the migration script:
#11506
items.title: Set experimental to false for widely supported features

items.content_html:
This PR illustrates unifying Window and WorkerGlobalScope in a globals.json file and marking worker support in sub features.

Features are exported as api.* (the schema doesn't like this, it wants these exports in one file per export)

Context: #9127
items.title: Unify Window and WorkerGlobalScope

items.content_html:
This PR illustrates a split of Window and WorkerGlobalScope using the mixins folder.

Context: #9127
items.title: Split Window and WorkerGlobalScope

items.content_html:
Various updates to font-size-adjust

I am working on mdn/content#6720

This PR adds a section for the two-value syntax now supported in Firefox.

While testing I realized the single value did not work in Chrome. It was behind a flag, however has been moved to test and therefore does not seem to be accessible using Experimental Web Platform Features now. https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=451346#c33 I have tested this and the removal seems to apply from Chrome 91.

I also updated the spec to point to the level 5 spec, as the level 4 spec does not include the two-value syntax.
items.title: Updates to font-size-adjust

items.content_html:
Adds spec URLs to the MIDI interfaces as I'm creating the documentation pages.

I also removed a duplicate statechange event from MIDIAccess, as this seemed to be a duplicate of onstatechange.
items.title: adds spec data to MIDI interfaces

items.content_html: This PR removes api.HTMLFrameSetElement.event_handlers from our data. Since the API doesn't define its own event handlers as the MDN article states (and I question whether this API actually has an onstorage event handler), there's no reason to have this feature around.
items.title: Remove redundant api.HTMLFrameSetElement.event_handlers feature

items.content_html: This PR adds real values for Firefox and Firefox Android for the pointerlock_event member of the Document API. The data for these events was mirrored from their event handler counterparts.
items.title: Add Firefox versions for api.Document.pointerlock_event

items.content_html:
Summary

Adding cause option to Error constructor.

Test results and supporting details

https://v8.dev/features/error-cause
items.title: Adding cause option to Error constructor

items.content_html:
This PR is a part of a project to add missing interfaces and interface features to BCD that are from an active spec (including WICG specs) and is supported in at least one browser. This particular PR adds the missing Counter API, populating the results using data from the mdn-bcd-collector project (v3.1.10).

Spec: https://www.w3.org/TR/DOM-Level-2-Style/css.html#CSS-Counter

Tests Used: https://mdn-bcd-collector.appspot.com/tests/api/Counter
items.title: Add missing Counter API

items.content_html:
This is the second and last bcd PR for #11301 (it can be landed independantly).

Initially there wasn't a <filter-function> CSS types, the 10 functions were defined directly on the CSS filterproperty.

With the addition of backdrop-filter, supporting the same filters, this changed and the 10 CSS functions are now defined on a type. MDN has created these pages long ago, but always linked to the bcd of the CSS filter property (that don't individualize the functions).

This fixes this by adding bcd for <filter-function>(implicitely added to the platform when filter has been added) and for each of the 10 functions, as subfeatures (added at the same time, but more were added in the future).

The mdn_url (already existing) and spec_url have been added too to point to the right pages/fragments.

This can land independantly of any other PR, nothing will break (even temporarily)
items.title: Add CSS <filter-function> and its 10 CSS functions to bcd

items.content_html:
These properties had no bcd directly on them, but only on their subfeatures. I added it (taking the earliest one). That way mdn_url and spec_url are at the right level.

This is similar to what we did in browser-compat-data/11214.

(No mdn content will be broken by this change, it will be improved and we will be able to source spec_url through {{Specifications}}
items.title: Fix multi display mode css

items.content_html: This PR simplifies the engine version for Safari 14.1 in our data, stripping out the micro and nano version numbers. Not only does this fine of information not really matter to us, but compareVersions doesn't like them, and the micro/nano versions have already changed in 14.1.1.
items.title: Simplify engine version for Safari 14.1

items.content_html:
PLEASE READ CAREFULLY. A unique problem requires a unique approach, which is described below.

The rename of 'Feature Policy' to 'Permissions Policy' requires that BCD be moved as well. Regardless of whether BCD is changed before MDN content or vice-versa, there will be a stage where BCD keys in MDN documents will point to data that isn't there. To get around this, I have duplicated the data. In other words, when this is deployed there will be data under the keys Feature-Policy and Permissions-Policy. This is by design. When the new MDN pages are deployed, I'll come back remove the data recorded under Feature-Policy.

mdn/content#1831
items.title: Part 1 of 2: copy feature policy to permissions policy.
